item.title: Haleon Site Visit | Oct. 29 (Registration Required)
item.description: Join the CCPD for a visit to Haleon’s Oak Hill manufacturing site in East Durham, NY on Wednesday, October 29th from 10am-1pm! You’ll be able to tour the facilities, learn about Haleon’s mission and values, and network with Haleon team members over a pizza lunch. Register in Handshake–transportation is provided but space is limited!

item.description: Friday / October 24, 2025 at 7:00 pm We Will Not Be Composed challenges perceptions of women’s anger in America. item.title: Fully Funded PhD Student Positions for Fall 2026 in Decision Sciences and Engineering Systems
item.description: The ISE Dept. is actively recruiting students with a strong background in engineering, mathematics, computer science, or other related fields. We offer fully funded PhD positions in optimization, data science, manufacturing systems, supply chain and logistics. We encourage you to attend our webinar on Nov. 7, 8:30 AM to 9:30 AM EST. All information session attendees will receive an application fee waiver. Webinar registration: https://apply.rpi.edu/register/ISE117
item.author: Community

item.title: Artist Mary Mattingly Speaks on October 22
item.description: Artist Mary Mattingly will discuss her recent work with an emphasis on Swale, a mobile, community-led food access initiative that transforms NYC waterways into civic spaces for environmental and economic justice. Built on a repurposed barge, Swale serves communities where it remains illegal to forage on public land, providing free access to perennial fruits, herbs, and vegetables while educating the public on sustainable food systems and land rights. West Hall 113 or Webex on Oct. 22 at 6pm.

item.description:
